sentences.en: An avaricious man is always needy.
Exceedingly eager for material gain; avaricious.
He is so avaricious that we call him a blood sucker.
sentences.cn: 他如此贪婪,我们都叫他吸血鬼.

sentences.en: He sacrificed his own career so that his avaricious brother could succeed.
sentences.cn: 他牺牲了自己的事业，这样他贪婪的弟弟才能成功。

sentences.en: He was insatiably avaricious the more he got , the more he wanted to have.
It's not the Agriculture Ministry but the avaricious enterprises that should be responsible for the accident.
sentences.cn: 事件曝光后,农林大臣太田诚一在接受采访时说这种大米对人体无害,不用大惊小怪.

sentences.en: She is an avaricious person and seldom helps others.
sentences.cn: 她是个贪婪的人,很少帮助别人.

sentences.en: The gentleman is also avaricious, much less pass student.
sentences.cn: 君子还爱财呢, 何况普通学生.

sentences.en: The old peasant avaricious and close - fisted fellow.
sentences.cn: 那个老农是个贪婪而又吝啬的家伙.

sentences.en: These priests are all thus, greedy and avaricious.
sentences.cn: 所有的神甫全一样, 又贪又吝.

sentences.en: They are avaricious and will do anything for money.
sentences.cn: 他们很贪婪,愿意为了钱做任何事情.

sentences.en: Tis the counsel of an avaricious man to beggars.
sentences.cn: 那种说法是吝啬鬼对穷鬼的劝告.

sentences.en: To save money for avaricious purposes is altogether different from saving it for economical purposes.
sentences.cn: 出于贪欲与吝啬而存钱与节俭是截然不同的概念.
为什么? 难道你也财迷?

trans.tran_cn: 贪婪的，贪得无厌的，狼贪虎视，饕
trans.tran_en: An avaricious person is very greedy for money or possessions
